subject: Re: [junit] using inner classes to factor out common tests?
msgSnippet: Quoth Greg Wilson: [...] ... How about making the nested class static?  Then there s no need for an instance of the outer class. -- Steven Taschuk           |
messageBody:
Quoth Greg Wilson: [...]
> [...] I will then derive concrete classes like TestUnitUnit from
> TestMethods; each derived class will override setUp() to initialize
> this.left, this.right, and this.expected.
> [...] Ah, inner classes: I need an instance of the outer
> class so that I can do "outer.new inner()", and the framework doesn't
> handle that. [...]

How about making the nested class static? Then there's no need
for an instance of the outer class.

--
Steven Taschuk | o- @
staschuk@... | 7O )
| " ( Hummingbird
